Module 4 - Testing and Documentation Assignment
  • API Reference

API Reference

Scraping API

This API scrapes GradCafe survey pages and converts each page into structured applicant records for downstream cleaning and loading.

module_2.scrape.save_data(data: list, filename: str = 'applicant_data.json') → None
module_2.scrape.scrape_data(pages: int = 5) → list

Cleaning API

This API cleans scraped applicant records by normalizing text fields, removing noise, and standardizing values for storage.

module_2.clean.clean_data(data: list) → list
module_2.clean.load_data(filename: str = 'applicant_data.json') → list
module_2.clean.save_data(data: list, filename: str = 'cleaned_applicant_data.json') → None

Save cleaned applicant data to JSON.

Load Data API

This API creates the target database schema and loads cleaned applicant JSONL records into PostgreSQL with validation and error handling.

Utilities for loading applicant data into PostgreSQL.

load_data.create_applicants_table(connection)

Create the applicants table if it does not already exist.

load_data.create_connection(db_name, db_user, db_password, db_host, db_port)

Create and return a PostgreSQL connection.

load_data.detect_file_encoding(file_path)

Detect the likely encoding for an input JSONL file.

load_data.load_data_from_jsonl(connection, jsonl_file)

Load applicant rows from a JSONL file into the database.

load_data.main()

Main function to orchestrate the data loading process.

load_data.parse_date(date_string)

Parse a date like Month DD, YYYY into YYYY-MM-DD.

load_data.parse_float(value)

Parse a float value, returning None when empty or invalid.

Query API

This API defines and executes analytics queries against the applicants table and formats results for CLI and dashboard display.

Query definitions and helpers for reporting on applicants data.

class query_data.RunQueryOptions(number_only: bool = False, percent_only: bool = False, number_labels: list[str] | None = None, pair_only: bool = False)

Display options for run_query formatting.

number_labels: list[str] | None = None
number_only: bool = False
pair_only: bool = False
percent_only: bool = False
query_data.clamp_query_limit(value, default=1)

Clamp LIMIT values to the allowed range [1, 100].

query_data.create_connection(db_name, db_user, db_password, db_host, db_port)

Create and return a PostgreSQL connection.

query_data.execute_query(connection, stmt, params=None)

Execute a SQL query and return rows plus column names.

query_data.format_display(rows, display_mode, display_labels=None)

Format query rows for supported dashboard display modes.

query_data.get_queries()

Return query metadata and SQL used by CLI and dashboard views.

query_data.get_query_params(query: dict)

Return query params as a tuple for execution.

query_data.get_query_stmt(query: dict)

Return the query statement object, with backward compatibility for legacy keys.

query_data.main()

Connect to the database and execute all configured queries.

query_data.run_query(connection, title, stmt, params=None, options: RunQueryOptions | None = None)

Run one query and print a formatted answer for CLI usage.

Flask App Factory

Flask application factory for the GradCafe analytics dashboard.

flask_app.create_app(test_config: dict[str, Any] | None = None) → Flask

Build and configure the Flask app instance.

Dashboard and Routes

Flask dashboard blueprint for GradCafe data and query reporting.

blueprints.dashboard.configure_dashboard(settings: dict[str, Any]) → None

Apply runtime dashboard settings from Flask app config.

blueprints.dashboard.create_applicants_table(connection)

Backward-compatible proxy to load_data table setup helper.

blueprints.dashboard.create_connection(db_config: dict[str, str | None] | None = None, database_url: str | None = None, **legacy_config: str | None)

Create a PostgreSQL connection from URL or discrete settings.

blueprints.dashboard.dashboard()

Render the analysis dashboard view.

blueprints.dashboard.fetch_applicant_row_by_url(connection, url: str) → dict[str, Any] | None

Fetch one applicant row by URL using the dashboard output schema.

blueprints.dashboard.load_query_results() → list[dict[str, Any]]

Execute all configured queries and return render-ready results.

blueprints.dashboard.pull_data()

Start a pull job, either backgrounded or inline.

blueprints.dashboard.pull_gradcafe_data(progress_callback: Callable[[...], None] | None = None, scraper_module=None, clean_module=None, connection_factory: Callable[[...], Any] | None = None) → dict[str, int]

Scrape new GradCafe data, insert unseen rows, and return stats.

blueprints.dashboard.pull_status()

Return current pull status for polling clients.

blueprints.dashboard.update_analysis()

Allow the UI to refresh analysis when no pull is running.

Route Summary

  • GET /: dashboard alias.

  • GET /analysis: renders analysis page.

  • POST /pull-data: starts pull job (foreground or background).

  • POST /update-analysis: refresh trigger endpoint.

  • GET /pull-status: pull status snapshot for polling.
